byline.contributor: Tim Arango contributed reporting from Istanbul.

abstract: Turkish resort town of Antalya has been spruced up and locked down in advance of Group of 20 summit meeting; Pres Recep Tayyip Erdogan hopes to burnish his country's reputation at meeting, particularly in light of growing international criticism about his government's crackdown on media and general sense that government has become more authoritarian.
lead_paragraph: The meeting of world leaders is an opportunity for a nation that has faced rising turmoil and instability to restore some of its luster on the world stage.

headline.main: In Hosting G-20, Turkey Strives to Bolster Its Status
headline.print_headline: Turkey Polishes Its Silver and Its Image for Global Meeting

snippet: The meeting of world leaders is an opportunity for a nation that has faced rising turmoil and instability to restore some of its luster on the world stage.
